choices.text:
Ingredients:

-3 large Granny Smith apples 
-1/2 cup sugar
-1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon 
-3 tablespoons all-purpose flour 
-1 tablespoon lemon juice 
-2 tablespoons butter 
-1 (9-inch) unbaked pastry shell 

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

2. Wash and peel apples, then cut into quarters and remove cores. Slice each quarter into thin slices.

3. In a large bowl, combine apples, sugar, cinnamon, flour, and lemon juice; toss gently to coat.

4. Spread the apple mixture into the unbaked pastry shell. Dot the top of the apples with butter.

5. Place the pie on a baking sheet and bake for 40 to 50 minutes until crust is golden brown and apples are tender. Allow to cool before serving. Enjoy!
